name: Cameroon
introduction: French Cameroon became independent in 1960 as the Republic of Cameroon. The following year the southern portion of neighboring British Cameroon voted to merge with the new country to form the Federal Republic of Cameroon. In 1972 a new constitution replaced the federation with a unitary state the United Republic of Cameroon. The country has generally enjoyed stability which has enabled the development of agriculture roads and railways as well as a petroleum industry. Despite slow movement toward democratic reform political power remains firmly in the hands of President Paul BIYA.
overview: Cameroon on the Gulf of Guinea is a Central African country of varied terrain and wildlife. Its inland capital Yaoundé and its biggest city the seaport Douala are transit points to ecotourism sites as well as beach resorts like Kribi – near the Chutes de la Lobé waterfalls which plunge directly into the sea – and Limbe where the Limbe Wildlife Centre houses rescued primates.

languages.name: Afade
languages.area: Borno state, Ngala LGA. 12 villages. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Bankon
languages.area: Littoral Province, Moungo Division, north of Douala and west of Wouri River, and Dibombari.

languages.name: Lidzonka

languages.name: Ambele

languages.name: Aghem

languages.name: Esimbi

languages.name: Akum

languages.name: Mandarin Chinese

Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.

languages.name: Modern Greek (1453-)
languages.area: Widespread, especially in Greek Macedonia. Also in Albania, Armenia, Australia, Austria, Bahamas, Bulgaria, Canada, Congo, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Egypt, France, Georgia, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Libya, Macedonia, Malawi, Mozambique, Paraguay, Poland, Romania, Russian Federation (Europe), Sierra Leone, South Africa, Sweden, Tunisia, Turkey (Europe), Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Adamawa Fulfulde

languages.name: Hausa
languages.area: Sokoto, Kaduna, Katsina, Kano, Bauchi, Jigawa, Zamfara, Kebbi, and Gombe states. Spoken as L2 in north. Also in Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, Congo, Eritrea, Germany, Ghana, Niger, Sudan, Togo.

languages.name: Kamwe
languages.area: Adamawa state, Michika LGA, Mandara Mountains.

languages.name: Hijuk

languages.name: Mina (Cameroon)

languages.name: Hya

languages.name: Ibibio
languages.area: Akwa Ibom state, Itu, Uyo, Etinan, Ikot Abasi, Ikono, Ekpe-Atai, Uruan, Onna, Nsit-Ubium, and Mkpat Enin LGAs.

languages.name: Igbo
languages.area: Abia state, Anambra state, Aguata, Anambra, Awka, Idemili, Ihiala, Njikoka, Nnewi, and Onitsha LGAs; Enugu state, Awgu, Enugu, Ezeagu, Igo-Etiti, Igbo-Eze, Isi-Uzo, Nkanu, Nsukka, Udi, and Uzo-Uwani LGAs; Imo state; Rivers state, Ikwerre, Bonny, and Ahoada LGAs; Delta state, Oshimili, Aniocha, and Ndokwa LGAs; Akwa Ibom state, Ika LGA. The only or majority language in Abia, Anambra, Ebonyi, Enugu, and Imo. Also in northeast Delta state and southeast Rivers state, Oyigbo LGA and Opobo part of Opobo-Nkoro LGA, and alongside Ibani [iby] in Bonny LGA.

languages.name: Isu (Menchum Division)
languages.area: North West Province, Menchum Division, Wum Central Subdivision, widespread to Nigeria border.

languages.name: Mesaka

languages.name: Jukun Takum

languages.name: Jina

languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Tsanaga Division, southwest Mokolo Subdivision. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Kendem
languages.area: South West Province, Manyu Division, Tinto and Upper Bayang subdivisions, east of Mamfe: Kendem, Kekpoti, and Bokwa villages.

languages.name: Kwakum
languages.area: East Province, Upper Nyong Division, Dimako and Doume subdivisions; Lom-and-Djerem Division, north of Bertoua; Belabo Subdivision.

languages.name: Karang
languages.area: North Province, Mayo-Rey Division, Madingring District [homeland], south border of Bouba Ndjida National Park, south from Madingring, southeast to Lawzigoy (toward Touboro). 25 villages. [displaced: Garoua, Ngong, Ngaoundéré, Touboro (and surrounding villages), Tcholliré]. Also in Chad.

languages.name: La'bi
languages.area: North Province, Mayo-Rey Division, Touboro Subdivision.

languages.name: Nomaande
languages.area: Center Province, Mbam Division, west and north Bokito Subdivision, southwest of Bafia.

languages.name: Leti (Cameroon)
languages.area: Center Province, Lekie Division, north Sa’a Subdivision, Sanaga River bend.

languages.name: Lefa
languages.area: Center Province, Mbam and Inoubou Division, Bafia Subdivision.

languages.name: Pévé
languages.area: Southwest near Cameroon border, Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Lamé home of Chef de Canton, and administrative center. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Limbum
languages.area: North West Province, Donga-Mantung Division, Nkambe Subdivision, Nkambe and Ndu area. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Laimbue
languages.area: North West Province, Menchum Division, Wum Central Subdivision; Boyo Division, Fundong Subdivision.

languages.name: Lamnso'
languages.area: North West Province, Bui Division, east Kumbo and Jakiri Subdivisions, northeast of Bamenda, Kumbo area. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Luo (Cameroon)
languages.area: A section of Atta.

languages.name: Mafa
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Tsanaga Division, from Mokolo north. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Mbo (Cameroon)
languages.area: Mbo plain, Littoral Province, Moungo Division, Nkongsamba and Melong subdivisions; West Province, Menoua Division, Santchou Subdivision and Upper Nkam Division, Kekem Subdivision.

languages.name: Masana
languages.area: Mayo-Kebbi Est region, Mayo-Boneye Department, Bongor Subprefecture, along Logone River. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Makaa
languages.area: East Province, north Upper Nyong Division, Messamena, Abong-Mbang, Doume, Nguelemendouka Subdivisions.

languages.name: Mambai
languages.area: North Province, Benoue Division, extreme north Bibemi Subdivision, along Mayo-Kebi River near Chad border. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Mengisa
languages.area: Center Province, Lekie Division, Sa’a Subdivision, Sanaga River bend area between the River and Sa’a.

languages.name: Cameroon Mambila
languages.area: Adamawa Province, on Nigeria border, northwest Mayo-Banyo Division, Banyo and Bankim Subdivisions.

languages.name: Mpiemo
languages.area: Nola Subprefecture. Also in Cameroon, Congo.

languages.name: Mbum
languages.area: West Mbum, isolated in Adamawa Province, Vina and Djerem divisions, south and southwest of Ngaoundere; North Province, Faro Division, Ngaoundere area to border of Faro Reserve; East Province, Lom-and-Djerem Division, Belabo Subdivision, Gbete. Also in Central African Republic, United States.

languages.name: Menka
languages.area: North West Province, Momo Division, Widikum-Menka Subdivision, west of Mbwengi, northwest of Batibo. 10 villages.

languages.name: Merey
languages.area: Far North Province, Diamare Division, Meri Massif, west of Meri.

languages.name: Mendankwe-Nkwen
languages.area: North West Province, Mezam Division, Bamenda Central Subdivision, north and east of Bamenda, either side of Ring Road, and mountainous circle of Menda Nkwe.

languages.name: Naki
languages.area: North West Province, Menchum Division, Furu-Awa Subdivision, Nse chiefdom, Naki, Mekaf, Bukpang II, and Lebo villages.

languages.name: Matal
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Sava Division, Mora Subdivision, southwest of Mora, to the south, east edge of Mandara Mountains.

languages.name: Wandala
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Sava Division, east of Mora, north and northwest in a semicircle, to Nigeria border. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Mefele
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Tsanaga Division, Mokolo Subdivision, south and east of Mokolo. 6 villages.

languages.name: North Mofu
languages.area: Far North Province, Diamare Division, massifs south of Meri.

languages.name: Mpumpong
languages.area: East Province. Menzime and Bangantu are in Kadey Division, Mbang Subdivision, south of Batouri; others in Boumba-and-Ngoko Division, south and west of Yokadouma.

languages.name: Meta'
languages.area: North West Province, Momo Division, east and southeast Mbengwi and east Batibo subdivisions; Bamenda Subdivision, Bafuchu and Nja village areas.

languages.name: Mungaka
languages.area: North West Province, Mezam Division, Bali Subdivision; West Province, Bamboutos Division, southeast Galim Subdivision; Mifi Division, north Bafoussam Subdivision.

languages.name: Mofu-Gudur
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Tsanaga Division into Diamare Division, Mokolo Subdivision, massifs south of Tsanaga River to Mayo-Louti River.

languages.name: Abar
languages.area: North West Province, Menchum Division, Wum Subdivision, Missong is center, with Munken, Abar, Ngun (Ngwen) and Za’ (Zak or Biya) villages.

languages.name: Byep
languages.area: East Province, north Upper Nyong Division, Messamena, Abong-Mbang, Doume, Nguelemendouka subdivisions; Lom and Djerem Division, east Diang Subdivision, west of Bertoua.

languages.name: Mbule
languages.area: Center Province, Mbam Division, south Bokito Subdivision, Mbola village.

languages.name: Vame
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Sava Division, Mora and Tokombere subdivisions, Southern Mora massif south of Mora.

languages.name: Moloko
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Sava Division, Tokombere Subdivision, Makalingay Canton, Melokwo Mountain and plains around its base.

languages.name: Mmaala
languages.area: Center Province, Mbam Division, Mmala canton, in and south of Bokito.

languages.name: Mundani
languages.area: South West Province, Manyu Division, Mamfe and north Fontem subdivisions, south of Batibo.

languages.name: Mpade
languages.area: Far North Province, Logone-and-Chari Division, south of Lake Chad, Makari area. Also in Chad, Nigeria.

languages.name: Mbuko
languages.area: Far North Province, Diamare Division, Meri Subdivision east of Meri, Mbuko massif and neighboring Mayo-Raneo plain.

languages.name: Mono (Cameroon)
languages.area: North Province, Mayo-Rey Division, north of Rey-Bouba, Kongrong area along Mayo-Godi River.

languages.name: Musey
languages.area: Mayo-Kebbi Est region, Kabbia and Mont d’Illi departments (Gounou Gaya, Fianga) and Tandjilé region, Tandjile Ouest Department (Kélo). Gounou Gaya is commercial and administrative center. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Maslam
languages.area: Far North Province, Logone-and-Chari Division, Makari Subdivision, northwest of Kousseri, Maltam and Saho. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Mbe'
languages.area: North West Province, Donga-Mantung Division, Nwa Subdivision, Mbo canton.

languages.name: Mundang
languages.area: Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Lac Léré and Mayo-Dallah departments (Léré, Pala), Mayo Kebbi Est region, Mont d’Illi Department (Fianga). Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Ajumbu
languages.area: North West Province, Menchum Division, Wum Subdivision, northeast of Wum, Mbu’ village.

languages.name: Musgu
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Danay Division, Maga Subdivision. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Nyong
languages.area: North West Province, Ngo-Ketunjia Division, Balikumbat Subdivision, near Ndop Plain in Balikumbat, Baligansin, and Baligashu villages; Mezam Division, Baligham. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Muyang
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Sava Division, northeast of Tokombere, Muyang, Mougouba, Gouadagouada, and Palbarar massifs.

languages.name: Malgbe
languages.area: Far North Province, Logone-and-Chari Division, Chari River area, Goulfey and Goulfey Subdivision, north of Kousseri. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Mada (Cameroon)
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Sava Division, Tokombere Subdivision, Mada massif at edge of Mandara Mountains and neighboring plain.

languages.name: Mbay
languages.area: Mandoul region, Barh Sara Department; around Moïssala. The traditional area is on the border of Chad and Central African Republic. Also in Central African Republic, Nigeria.

languages.name: Manta
languages.area: South West Province, Manyu Division northeast of Mamfe, from Mom border, Akwaya Subdivision, to Manta, Mamfe Subdivision. About 20 villages.

languages.name: Malimba
languages.area: Littoral Province, Sanaga-Maritime Division, small pocket north of Edea, and Sanaga River mouth area.

languages.name: Mumuye
languages.area: Taraba state, Jalingo, Zing, Karim Lamido, Yorro, Bali LGAs; Adamawa state, Ganye, Fufore, Yola, Numan, and Mayo Belwa LGAs.

languages.name: Manza
languages.area: Bouca, Kaga Bandoro, Mbrès, Dekoa, Sibut, Grimari subprefectures.

languages.name: Ngamambo
languages.area: North West Province, Momo Division, east and southeast Mbengwi and east Batibo subdivisions; Mezam Division, Santa Subdivision, Bafuchu and Nja village areas.

languages.name: Ncane
languages.area: North West Province, Donga-Mantung Division, Misaje Subdivision, Nkanchi, Nfume, Chunge, Bem, Kibbo and Mungong villages; Menchum Division, Bum Subdivision, Mungong.

languages.name: Kenswei Nsei
languages.area: North West Province, Ngo Ketunjia Division, Ndop Subdivision, west of Ndop on Ndop Plain, Bamessing village area.

languages.name: Samba Leko
languages.area: Adamawa state, Ganye, Fufore, Wukari, and Takum LGAs. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Ndoola
languages.area: Taraba state, Bali, Gashaka, Sardauna LGAs. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Dugun
languages.area: North Province, Faro Division, Poli Subdivision, southeast of Poli.

languages.name: Mfumte
languages.area: North West Province, Donga-Mantung Division, Nwa Subdivision, Mfumte canton north of Nwa and east of Nkambe. 16 villages.

languages.name: Ngemba
languages.area: North West Province, Mezam Division, Tuba and west Bamenda subdivisions.

languages.name: Ngie
languages.area: North West Province, Momo Division, west Mbengwi Subdivision, Andek area.

languages.name: Ngwo
languages.area: North West Province, Momo Division, Njikwa Subdivision.

languages.name: Gvoko
languages.area: Borno state, Gwoza LGA; Adamawa state, Michika LGA. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Nagumi
languages.area: North Province, Benoue Division, Garoua Subdivision between Benoue and Faro rivers and Poli Mountains.

languages.name: Tibea
languages.area: Center Province, Mbam Division, extreme north Ngoro Subdivision, northeast of Bafia. 3 villages.

languages.name: Noone
languages.area: North West Province, Bui Division, northwest Kumbo Subdivision.

languages.name: Nzanyi
languages.area: Adamawa state, Maiha LGA. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Njen
languages.area: North West Province, Momo Division, southeast of Batibo, Njen village.

languages.name: Njyem
languages.area: East Province, Upper Nyong Division, Ngoila Subdivision. Also in Congo.

languages.name: Nkongho
languages.area: South West Province, Kupe-Muanenguba Division, Nguti Subdivision.

languages.name: Ngombale
languages.area: West Province, Bamboutos Division, north Mbouda Subdivision, northwest of Mbouda.

languages.name: Kwasio
languages.area: South Province, Ocean Division, Kribi and Lolodorf subdivisions, Kribi forests area; Kribi to Lolodorf. Also in Equatorial Guinea.

languages.name: Ndemli
languages.area: Littoral Province, Nkam Division, between Yabassi, Yingui, and Nkondjok.

languages.name: Nimbari
languages.area: North Province, Benoue Division, Basheo Subdivision, Gorimbari village; Mayo-Louti Division, Guider Subdivision, Padjara-Djabi and Badjire villages.

languages.name: Ngiemboon
languages.area: West Province, Bamboutos Division, Batcham Subdivision and west Mbouda Subdivision in Balatchi; Menoua Division, north of Penka-Michel.

languages.name: Nda'nda'
languages.area: West Province, straddling Upper Nkam (east of Bana), Nde (north and west of Bangante), and Mifi (south of Bangou) divisions.

languages.name: Ngoshie
languages.area: North West Province, Momo Division, east Njikwa Subdivision.

languages.name: Ngwe
languages.area: South West Province, Lebialem Division.

languages.name: Tigon Mbembe
languages.area: North West Province, Donga-Mantung Division, Ako Subdivision, north of Nkambe. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Nzakambay
languages.area: Logone Oriental region, Monts de Lam Department, Baïbokoum Subprefecture, Cameroon border, near Baïbokoum; Zoli in Monts de Lam area. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Oblo
languages.area: Benoue Division, Pitoa Subdivision, Gobtikéré, Ouro Bé, and Ouro Badjouma areas.

languages.name: Oku
languages.area: North West Province, Bui Division, west Jakiri Subdivision, Mt. Oku and Lake Oku area.

languages.name: Osatu
languages.area: South West Province, Manyu Division, Akwaya Subdivision, southeast of Asumbo.

languages.name: Koonzime
languages.area: East Province, Upper Nyong Division, Lomie area (north and northwest, south and southeast to Dja River).

languages.name: Parkwa
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Sava Division, Mora Subdivision, west and southwest of Mora.

languages.name: Peere
languages.area: Northwestern Tignere Subdivision between Tignere and Nigeria border, Faro and Deo Division; northeast of Banyo, Mayo-Banyo Division, Adamawa Province. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Sudanese Creole Arabic
languages.area: South, widespread in Equatoria region, into Bahr al Ghazal and Upper Nile regions. Refugees have gone to other countries.

languages.name: Pomo
languages.area: East Province, Upper Nyong Division, Dimako Subdivision, east of Doume; Lom and Djerem Division, east of Belabo. Also in Congo.

languages.name: Pam
languages.area: North Province, Mayo-Rey Division, near Tchollire.

languages.name: Pinyin
languages.area: North West Province, Mezam Division, southwest Bamenda Subdivision, southwest of Bamenda.

languages.name: Pana (Central African Republic)
languages.area: Bocaranga Subprefecture. Also in Cameroon, Chad, Nigeria.

languages.name: Sango
languages.area: Widespread. Also in Chad, Congo, Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Ngambay
languages.area: Logone Occidental region; Logone Oriental region, Lanya Department (Bébedjia), La Nya Pendé Department, Goré Subprefecture; Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Mayo-Dallah Department. Centered in Moundou area. Also in Cameroon, Nigeria.

languages.name: Suga
languages.area: Adamawa Province, Faro-and-Deo Division, Galim area southwest of Tignere; Mayo-Banyo Division, north Banyo Subdivision, Sambolabbo area.

languages.name: Chadian Arabic
languages.area: Salamat, Ouaddaï, Wadi Fira regions, Batha region center and west, much of Chari-Baguirmi; Mayo-Kebbi; north Tandjilé; Guéra. Also in Cameroon, Central African Republic, Niger, Nigeria.

languages.name: Swo
languages.area: Center Province, Nyong-and-Mfoumou Division, Akonolinga Subdivision, Melan and Emvane cantons; East Province, a few in Upper Nyong Division.

languages.name: Sharwa
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Tsanaga Division, South Bourrah Subdivision; a few in North Province, Mayo-Louti Division.

languages.name: Isu (Fako Division)
languages.area: South West Province, Fako Division, Tiko Subdivision, Bimbia estuary area east of Limbe and west of Douala.

languages.name: Tikar
languages.area: Center Province, Mbam Division, Ngambe-Tikar Subdivision, scattered over northwest Yoko and northeast of Foumban; Adamawa Province, Mayo-Banyo Division, Bankim Subdivision; West Province, Noun Division, Magba Subdivision.

languages.name: Tiv
languages.area: Benue state, Makurdi, Gwer, Gboko Kwande, Vandeikya, and Katsina Ala LGAs; Plateau state, Lafia LGA; Taraba state, Bali, Takum, and Wukari LGAs. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: To
languages.area: North Province, Mayo-Rey Division, Touboro Subdivision. Also in Central African Republic.

languages.name: Tsuvan
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Tsanaga Division, southeast Bourrah Subdivision, northeast of Dourbeye, Tchevi village, 5 quarters found in an area 10 km in diameter; some in North Province, Mayo-Louti Division.

languages.name: Tuotomb
languages.area: Center Province, Mbam Division, Bafia Subdivision, Ndikinemeki area, Bonek village. Urban.

languages.name: Tupuri
languages.area: Far North Province, Kaele Division, southeast Moulvouday plain east of Kaele; Mayo-Danay Division, Kar-Hay Subdivision. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Twendi
languages.area: Adamawa Province, Mayo-Banyo Division, north of Bankim, Sanga village.

languages.name: Wuzlam
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Sava Division, Tokombere Subdivision, Wuzlam Massif south of Mora.

languages.name: Iyive
languages.area: South West Province, Manyu Division, northeast of Akwaya on Nigeria border, Yive village. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Usaghade
languages.area: South West Province, Ndian Division, Isangele Subdivision, near the coast. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Vemgo-Mabas
languages.area: Adamawa state, Michika LGA, Madagali District. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Mom Jango
languages.area: Adamawa state, Yola and Fufore LGAs, Verre hills. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Vute
languages.area: Center Province, northeast Mbam Division; Upper Sanaga Division, near Nanga-Eboko and Mbandjok; Adamawa Province, Mayo-Banyo and Djerem divisions (near Tibati and Banyo); some in East Province, west Lom and Djerem Division. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Weh
languages.area: North West Province, Menchum Division, Wum Central Subdivision, Weh village.

languages.name: Cameroon Pidgin
languages.area: Primarily South West and North West provinces; widespread elsewhere.

languages.name: Longto
languages.area: North Province, Faro Division, Poli Subdivision, southwest of Poli to Faro Reserve, Voko area.

languages.name: Wom (Nigeria)
languages.area: Adamawa state, Fufore LGA.

languages.name: Wawa
languages.area: Adamawa Province, Mayo-Banyo Division, Bankim Subdivision, west of Banyo, 13 villages.

languages.name: Hdi
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Tsanaga Division, Mokolo Subdivision, Nigeria border northwest of Mokolo. 15 villages. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Mbonga
languages.area: East Province, Lom-and-Djerem Division, near Betare-Oya.

languages.name: Mbudum
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Tsanaga Division, Mokolo Subdivision, Northeast of Hina.

languages.name: Mengaka
languages.area: West Province, Bamboutos Division, South Galim Subdivision, Bagam, Galim, and Bamendjing.

languages.name: Majera
languages.area: Far North Province, Logone-and-Chari Division, extreme south Logone-Birni Subdivision, Majera area. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Kuo
languages.area: Logone Oriental region, Monts de Lam Department, Baibokoum Subprefecture, near Baibokoum, Pao, and Bouroum cantons. Villages are on roads: north-south road from Pao to Laramanay, northwest from Pao, and northwest from Laramanay to Bouroum. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Yamba
languages.area: North West Province, Donga-Mantung Division, Central Nwa Subdivision. Seasonal immigrants in Nigeria, Mambila Plateau. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Nugunu (Cameroon)
languages.area: Center Province, Mbam Division, Ombessa and Bokito subdivisions, Ombessa area southwest.

languages.name: Yambeta
languages.area: Center Province, Mbam Division, Bafia Subdivision northwest of Bafia.

languages.name: Yangben
languages.area: Center Province, Mbam Division, Bokito Subdivision, Yangben Canton south of Bokito.

languages.name: Yemba
languages.area: West Province, Menoua Division, Dschang area.

languages.name: Yukuben
languages.area: Taraba state, Takum LGA, between Katsina Ala and Gamana rivers. About 20 villages. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Yeni
languages.area: Nyalang area north of Mayo Darle village.

languages.name: Yasa
languages.area: South Province, Ocean Division, Campo Subdivision, on the coast near Equatorial Guinea. Also in Equatorial Guinea, Gabon.

languages.name: Zhoa
languages.area: North-West Province, Menchum Division, Fungom Subdivision. 1 village.

languages.name: Zizilivakan
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Tsanaga Division, Bourrah Subdivision, near Nigeria border. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Zumaya
languages.area: Far North Province, Diamare Division, Maroua Subdivision, Ouro-Lamorde.
